clues: ['This city has a famous clock tower that many mistake for its bell’s name.', 'The River Thames flows through its heart, with historic bridges crossing it.']
fun_fact: ['Big Ben actually refers to the bell inside the tower, not the clock itself.', 'London has over 170 museums, including the British Museum, which is free to enter.']
trivia: ['Red double-decker buses and black cabs are iconic symbols of this city.', "London Underground is the world's oldest metro system, opening in 1863."]

clues: ['This city is home to an opera house with a unique sail-like design.', 'Its famous harbor bridge is often climbed by adventurous visitors.']
fun_fact: ['The Sydney Opera House took 14 years to build and cost over $100 million.', 'Sydney’s Bondi Beach is one of the most famous surf spots in the world.']
trivia: ['Kangaroos and koalas can be found in the nearby Blue Mountains National Park.', 'Sydney was the first European settlement in Australia, founded in 1788.']

clues: ['This city has the tallest building in the world, towering over 828 meters.', 'A man-made island shaped like a palm tree can be seen from space.']
fun_fact: ['Dubai was a small fishing village before transforming into a global metropolis.', 'The city has a police force that includes luxury cars like Lamborghinis.']
trivia: ['Dubai Mall is one of the largest shopping malls in the world with over 1,200 stores.', 'Despite being in a desert, Dubai has an indoor ski resort.']
